title: Using the Terminal & Installing Coding Platforms

items: Understand how to navigate Linux using the terminal
Set up a coding platform (like VS Code) on Linux

sections.heading: Using the Terminal
paragraphs: The terminal is a text-based interface that lets you control your computer by typing commands.
It can be faster and more powerful than using a mouse (GUI), especially for programming tasks.

sections.heading: Installing a Coding Platform (VS Code Example)
paragraphs: To code efficiently on Linux, you can install VS Code — a popular code editor.
Visit the VS Code website and download the Linux installer (.deb for Debian/Ubuntu, .rpm for Fedora).
Then, install it using the terminal.

sections.heading: Optional: Install Git for Version Control
paragraphs: Git helps you track changes in code and collaborate with others.

bullets: The terminal allows you to control your system with typed commands.
Common commands include navigating folders and creating files.
VS Code can be installed on Linux using `.deb` or `.rpm` packages.
Git is a helpful tool for coding and collaboration.

questions.prompt: What is the terminal used for?
choices: Typing commands to control the system
